title: HTML
copy: HTML is usually the easy part of any project, especially when we're using frameworks to build it dynanically. I have extensive experience in building HTML with frameworks like React as well the old-fashioned way.

title: CSS
copy: I build responsive, accessible websites using the latest CSS with broad browser support on both desktop and mobile platforms, as well as preprocessing with SASS/SCSS. I'm somewhat familiar with CSS frameworks like Tailwind and Bootstrap, though I do not use them regularly.

title: React
copy: I've come to really love the flexibility and speed that come from working in React. For small- to medium-sized projects there's really no better way to get a site built and deployed quickly.

title: Git/GitHub
copy: I'm experienced with code version control, branch management, and collaborative workflows in Git and GitHub. I created and manage a large repository for HTML content on multiple websites using both shared, custom JavaScript and CSS assets.

title: JavaScript
copy: I've built a number of front-end interactive elements, animations, and interfaces with back-end APIs using JavaScript from sliders to modals to fully interactive product configurators. I've got some experience with modern JavaScript frameworks like React as well.

title: Typescript
copy: While Typescript is not currently part of the build process in my current work, I've used it occasionally in side-projects and am familiary with its benefits and drawbacks.

title: WCAG/A11y
copy: Part of my work has been taking responsibilty for updating our websites to adhere as closely as possible to WCAG accessibility guidelines, including coding JavaScript widgets allowing for keyboard navigation, etc., as required.

title: Node.js
copy: I've used Node to build serverless APIs for several projects, most notably a hummingbird migration map that interfaces with several APIs, including Firebase, Google Maps, and Magento.

title: Google Firebase/Cloud Functions
copy: I've made use of Google Cloud Services for several projects, including the hummingbird migration map mentioned above. This has included NOSQL databases, form processing, cloud functions, and cloud storage.

title: Microsoft Power Automate
copy: I've automated processes by using PowerAutomate, including forms which feed via SharePoint to various Excel sheets, as well as interfacing with desktop software like Microsoft Teams for approval functionality for image submission.

title: Magento
copy: While I am not a Magento developer, I've become very familiar and comfortable with the Magento admin and the opportunities and limits to creating content for Magento from within the admin.
